ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This was a fabulous course. I would highly recommend it to Ethnicity, Race and Migration majors in Yale College, in particular. I was really interested in the interaction between race and law, so this course was fascinating. While the course name AFAM 829 might make a student think that the course focused solely on African American legal history, in reality, the course touched on a much broader body of literature, which included the cases involving Native Americans, the Japanese and the Chinese. Definitely take it if you're considering it!

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
